description: Grafana Dashboard for Veeam Backup for AWS v4 (Grafana 8.x / InfluxDB v2.x)

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_overview")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "Policies")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_overview")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "Repositories")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_overview")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "VMs")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_overview")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "InstancesUsed")
  |> group(columns: ["version"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_overview")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "InstancesUsed")
  |> group(columns: ["LicenseType"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)

panels.description:
On this Map, you can quickly know which VMs are not Protected by Veeam Backup for AWS. 
With a simple, yet powerful view, you can understand and try to mitigate the red spots.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_vm_unprotected")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "UPVM" and r._value >=1)
  |> group(columns: ["geohash","VMRegion"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

panels.title: Unprotected VMs

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_vm_protected")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "TotalVMs")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_vm_unprotected")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "TotalVMs")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly know how much time did a Backup, or Snapshot Policy take. You can quickly filter by Policy Name on the top menu.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_sessions")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "sessionDuration")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sessionType"] =~ /${PolicyType:regex}/)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sessionPolicyJobName"] =~ /${PolicyName:regex}/)
  |> group(columns: ["sessionPolicyJobName","sessionType"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
SELECT last("sessionDuration") FROM "veeam_aws_sessions" WHERE ("sessiontype" != '4') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "sessionPolicyJobName", "sessiontype" fill(none)

panels.title: Job and Policies Duration

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_sessions")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "sessionStatus")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["sessionPolicyJobName"] =~ /${PolicyName:regex}/)
  |> group(columns: ["sessionPolicyJobName","sessionType"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly list all your protected VPC on the different Regions

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_vpc")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "vpcprotected")
  |> group(columns: ["vpcid","vpcregion"])
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.title: Protected Amazon VPC

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly list all your Protected EC2 Instances

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_vm")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "VMSize")
  |> group(columns: ["VMName","VMRegion","VMType"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Protected VMs

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly list all your unprotected EC2 Instances

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_vm_unprotected")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "VMSize")
  |> group(columns: ["VMName","VMRegion","VMType"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Unprotected VMs

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly list all your protected RDS Instances

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_rds")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "rdssize")
  |> group(columns: ["rdsname","rdsclass","rdsengine","rdsengineversion","rdsregion","rdsdns"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Protected Amazon RDS

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly list all your protected EFS Instances

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_efs")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "rdssize")
  |> group(columns: ["efsname","efsperformance","efsregion","efsawsid"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Protected Amazon EFS

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly list all your repositories, with their bucket location, folder, region, and if the Encryption is enabled or not.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_repositories")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "repoEncryption")
  |> group(columns: ["repoBucket","repoDescription","repoFolderName","repoName","repoRegion"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Veeam Backup for AWS Repositories

panels.description: On this Panel, you can quickly list all your Policies.

targets.query:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_policies")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "PolicySnapshotCount")
  |> group(columns: ["PolicyDescription","PolicyName","PolicyStatus","PolicyType"])
  |> last()

panels.title: Veeam Backup for AWS Policies

list.definition:
from(bucket: v.defaultBucket)
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "veeam_aws_sessions")
  |> keep(columns: ["sessionPolicyJobName"])
  |> distinct(column: "sessionPolicyJobName")
  |> group()
list.label: Policy Name
list.name: PolicyName

  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)

  |> keep(columns: ["sessionPolicyJobName"])
  |> distinct(column: "sessionPolicyJobName")
  |> group()
